instructions: Open your phone's settings, then tap Wi-Fi or Wireless Networks . Tap the network you'd like to join. In most cases, you'll need to enter a password. Like with your home network, you can have your phone remember many Wi-Fi networks. If it's a friend's home or a business you come to a lot, your phone will automatically connect when you return. You won't need to enter the password every time. Once connected to the Wi-Fi network, you can set up your phone to enable Wi-Fi calling. From your phone's home screen, tap Phone . These steps may vary a bit depending on the type of phone you have and what operating system you are running. Tap the Menu or More icon to open the settings. Some phones have their settings available directly on the main app screen. Toggle Wi-Fi Calling on and you should be good to go.
